topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Deploy the Infoblox Patch

section.note: This patch is not required for Denver deployments.
section.p: This is optional patch and is applicable only when using Infoblox as an IP address management application (IPAM).
This patch addresses the following issues:

ul.li: Support subnet_shared_for_creation and subnet_shared_for_deletion options in infoblox_conditional.conf file.
Support for deleting subnets (neutron subnet-delete) gracefully and exiting proprly without a NetView instnace being present on the Infoblox appliance.

Fixing an issue that caused the neutron port-delete to fail inside the IPAM plugin code while executing following commands:neutron port-create <network id> --vnic-type direct neutron port-delete <port id>

body.section:
Download the patch
If you have not downloaded the patch, launch the Helion Distribution Network (HDN). You must obtain a user account on HDN in order to download these files. In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
Download the patch and the associated checksum and signature files.
Verify the downloaded signature and the downloaded checksums.
Extract the compressed file until the hp-poc-20160229.patchfile and README are available:
Extract the HCG2.0_Infoblox001_Patch021.tar.gz compressed file.
Extract the HCG2.0_Infoblox001_Patch021.tar compressed file.

ol.li: SSH into the lifecycle manager host as the root user.

Log into the lifecycle manager VM as root. ssh <lifecycle manager_VM_IP>
where: lifecycle manager_VM_IP is the CLM IP of the lifecycle manager. Locate the IP address for the lifecycle manager in the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file under hlm_clmstaticip field.

SSH into a controller using the CLM IP of the controller. Log in as the cghelion user. No password is required.ssh cghelion@<CLM_IP>
The CLM IP is located on the lifecycle manager VM in the /var/hlm/clouds/lr4tb2c1b41/desired_state/lr4tb2c1b41/001/base/stage/ansible/hosts file. Look in the [BASE-CCP-T1] section:BASE-CCP-T1-M1-NETCLM ansible_ssh_host=10.20.37.102 BASE-CCP-T1-M2-NETCLM ansible_ssh_host=10.20.37.103 BASE-CCP-T1-M3-NETCLM ansible_ssh_host=10.20.37.104
. Copy the hp-poc-20160229.patch file to the /tmp/ directory on the controller.
Execute following command to apply patch: patch -p1 < /tmp/hp-poc-20160229.patch

Edit the /etc/neutron/infoblox_conditional.conf on the controller to add the following parameter in the section with "network_view": "management"."subnet_shared_for_deletion": true
Refer to the infoblox_conditional_sample.conf file included in the patch download files. For example:{ "condition": "subnet_range:10.86.35.0/24", "is_external": false, "network_view": "management", "disable_dhcp": true, "dhcp_members": "infoblox.localdomain", "require_dhcp_relay": false, "subnet_shared_for_deletion": true, "domain_suffix_pattern": "{subnet_name}.cloud.global.com", "hostname_pattern": "{instance_name}-{ip_address}" },
Execute the following command to restart the Networking (Neutron) service:service neutron-server restart
Repeat these steps on all three controllers in the Standard Region.
For Sacramento deployments, repeat these steps on the controller in the Baremetal Region.
